intro: Petasites corymbosus, commonly known as the clustered buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in length, often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers arranged in corymbs, which bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Petasites corymbosus is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
